2.text: “Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, even by reason of my haste that is in me.

3.text: I have heard the reproof which puts me to shame. The spirit of my understanding answers me.

4.text: Don’t you know this from old time, since man was placed on earth,

5.text: that the triumphing of the wicked is short, the joy of the godless but for a moment?

6.text: Though his height mount up to the heavens, and his head reach to the clouds,

7.text: yet he shall perish forever like his own dung. Those who have seen him shall say, ‘Where is he?’

8.text: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found. Yes, he shall be chased away like a vision of the night.

9.text: The eye which saw him shall see him no more, neither shall his place any more see him.

10.text: His children shall seek the favor of the poor. His hands shall give back his wealth.

11.text: His bones are full of his youth, but youth shall lie down with him in the dust.

12.text: “Though wickedness is sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue,

13.text: though he spare it, and will not let it go, but keep it still within his mouth;

14.text: yet his food in his bowels is turned. It is cobra venom within him.

15.text: He has swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again. God will cast them out of his belly.

16.text: He shall suck cobra venom. The viper’s tongue shall kill him.

17.text: He shall not look at the rivers, the flowing streams of honey and butter.

18.text: That for which he labored he shall restore, and shall not swallow it down. According to the substance that he has gotten, he shall not rejoice.

19.text: For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor. He has violently taken away a house, and he shall not build it up.

20.text: “Because he knew no quietness within him, he shall not save anything of that in which he delights.

21.text: There was nothing left that he didn’t devour, therefore his prosperity shall not endure.

22.text: In the fullness of his sufficiency, distress shall overtake him. The hand of everyone who is in misery shall come on him.

23.text: When he is about to fill his belly, God will cast the fierceness of his wrath on him. It will rain on him while he is eating.

24.text: He shall flee from the iron weapon. The bronze arrow shall strike him through.

25.text: He draws it forth, and it comes out of his body. Yes, the glittering point comes out of his liver. Terrors are on him.

26.text: All darkness is laid up for his treasures. An unfanned fire shall devour him. It shall consume that which is left in his tent.

27.text: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity. The earth shall rise up against him.

28.text: The increase of his house shall depart. They shall rush away in the day of his wrath.

29.text: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, the heritage appointed to him by God.”
